verses.text: For Zion’s sake I will not keep silence, for Jerusalem’s sake I will not rest, till her victory issue forth clear as the light, her deliverance bright as a burning torch,
so that nations will see you are victor indeed, and kings, every one, will behold your glory. But you will be called by a name that is new, which the Lord’s mouth will determine.
Fair crown you will be in the hand of the Lord, a diadem royal in the hand of your God.

No more will your name be forsaken, nor your land called desolate more: but your name will be called my delight, and your land my wedded wife; for the Lord delights in you, and your land will indeed be wedded.
For even as a youth weds a maiden, so your builder will wed with you; and as bridegroom rejoices in bride, so your God will rejoice over you.
Over your walls, Jerusalem, I have appointed watchmen; all the day and night they never hold their peace. You whose task it is to keep the Lord in mind,
take to yourselves no rest, and give no rest unto him, until that he establish, until that he make Jerusalem renowned in the earth.
By his right hand the Lord has sworn, and by his mighty arm: “Never again will I suffer your foes to devour your corn; never again will strangers drink the wine for which you have toiled.
But those who have garnered will eat it, with songs of praise to the Lord; and those who have gathered will drink it within my holy courts.”
Pass you, pass through the gates, prepare you a way for the people; cast you, cast up the highway, and gather out the stones, and raise for the peoples a banner.
Behold, to the ends of the earth has the Lord made proclamation: say to the daughter of Zion, behold, your salvation is come. Behold his reward is with him, and his recompense before him,
they will call them the holy people, the redeemed of the Lord, and you will be called frequented, the city unforsaken.
